title: [$250] Multi-level categories/tags with colons are not displayed with hierarchical indentation in NewDot

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven't already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** N/A **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Logs:** N/A **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** N/A **Issue reported by:** @brianlee-expensify **Slack conversation:** https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1770752446067979 ## Action Performed: 1. Create or use a workspace with multi-level categories that use colons as separators (e.g. `Primary:Secondary:Tertiary`) 2. Open an expense and view the category selector in NewDot ## Expected Result: Multi-level categories should be displayed with hierarchical indentation (like in Classic/OldDot), where sub-categories are visually nested under their parent categories. For example: ``` Primary Secondary Tertiary Professional Services ``` ## Actual Result: Categories are displayed as flat, colon-separated strings (e.g. `Primary:Secondary:Tertiary`), making them hard to read — especially for long or deeply nested category names. The full text is also difficult to read at the individual expense level because the display area is too narrow for long concatenated names. In Classic/OldDot, the dropdown properly parses the colons and renders sub-categories with indentation, which is significantly more readable. ## Workaround: Users can hover over each option in NewDot to see the full text, but this is far less efficient than the Classic hierarchical display. ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos **NewDot (current — flat colon-separated display):** Long category names like `General and Administrative Expenses/Other Ge...` are truncated and hard to read. **Classic/OldDot (expected — hierarchical indentation):** Categories with colons are parsed and displayed with visual nesting: - `Primary` shown at root level - `Secondary` indented under Primary - `Tertiary` further indented under Secondary cc @JmillsExpensify @puneetlath @dannymcclain @shawnborton --- [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @ZhenjaHorbach

title: [$250] [CFI] Start all New Expensify users on `Reports` > `Reports`

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We currently land New Expensify users on either Reports > To-do > Submit or Reports > To-do > Approve, depending on whether they're approvers or not. While this is arguably the most "action-oriented" landing spot, we're realized that it's confusing because users expect to land on a list of "All" expenses or reports, which they can then filter down. By landing them on To-dos, we land them on a pre-filtered list of results that they then try to filter down further and end up with no results. Accordingly, the changes in this issue are: - Initially land all users on `Reports` > `Explore` > `Reports` (yes, reports like IOUs even exist off workspace) - Move `Explore` to the top of the LHN, in connection with `Reports` being the starting point - The order of the options in `Explore` is: - Reports - Expenses - Chats - The rest of the order of the LHN is unchanged from today, so: - Explore - To-dos - Accounting - Saved - Insights - Also unchanged from today, if you land on `Reports` > `Reports`, navigate to other saved/default view, and then go to another page, we remember where you last were. cc @shawnborton
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @ChavdaSachin

  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~022021261181181768541
  • Upwork Job ID: 2021261181181768541
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-02-10

title: [$250] Update badge styles

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
We'd like to sightly update the style of our badges found in the app. We currently use badges in various places like counters on the Reports page LHN, free trial badge in the Inbox, Wallet balance in the Account page LHN, and report statuses shown in the Reports page and Inbox pages. The idea here is to not change anything about where badges are located or how they function - we just want to update the styling to better match the rest of the product's design. We want to make sure the badge component is pretty bullet proof: - ability to choose between regular (default) height or condensed height - ability to use an icon on the left side - ability to choose a state (see image above) cc @Expensify/design @Expensify/product-pr @puneetlath @quinthar for visibility
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @dukenv0307

Open the Native app 2. Navigate to Account > Troubleshoot > Enable debug mode and use staging server 3. Go to a workspace > Company cards > Add cards 4. Select the United States and Direct feed 5.
